description: K1 Speed Toronto,is the first choice for anyone who wants to experience genuine racing in state-of-the-art, European,electric karts that are eco-friendly,safety-oriented and provide superior performance to traditional gas-powered karts. Our K1 Speed facility is designated as a large entertainment venue with professionally designed tracks and cutting edge decor.

reviews.title: NOT FAMILY FREINDLY
text: Could not believe the attitude of the sales rep at the counter , went with my two grandsons age 12 and 10 , was told kids amd adults couldn't use the track at the same time , ( I can understand that premise , aggressive young adults should be on the track together not with young kids !  ) so I asked okay  when can my grandson go , maybe 4:30 today she said,  IT WAS 12,30 ???? , would you like to wait I was asked sarcastically ? ......what a farce I was told well we have lots of adults here and some private functions you know !!! I was told ......like I was asking for a favor or lol

reviews.title: Pulled out for putting others in danger
text: My partner Maricris L. was pulled out almost at the start, ust because I crashed her kart 3x (one on each lap), putting in danger everyone around her..! Unfairly targeted because  she just accelerated and never held the wheel!! GREAT TIMES

reviews.title: Worst experience
text: Worst experience ever. Do not go there. My son who is 9years old and 54 inches tall was not aloud to use their  go carts . He was there with for a birthday party and is taller than some of his friends. 48 inch is not the actual height requirement .
No where dose it say that on your website . He was a trooper and didn’t complain but I know he had to watch all his friends try .
They say they are big on safety which is also wrong . Every time he pushed the peddle his seat would move back and this is why they would not let him drive.
Horrible experience

reviews.title: Great place 5 stars
text: This place was great, all of the people giving it 1 star and complaining, all of the issues were their fault or another customers, which does not put K1 at fault. The track was fun, the karts and helmets were clean with good upkeep. Karts we’re fast with clean handling. You should always call ahead or reserve a spot because it gets VERY busy at times. Don’t come in with a party of children, without calling or reserving because you will have to wait a long time because as i mentioned before, it gets busy. The staff was welcoming and accommodating and helped us right away. They even gave driving tips. some people writing reviews here are inconsiderate  because they caused the reason to their unpleasant experience.

reviews.title: the best
text: it was fun . we had it great the crouse was cool the food was great they even had an iced tea coke and brisk cooler .1 downside is the rooms were small but very  fun we still  lots of fun and it did take about 35 minutes to start the next race.all in all it is very good and have recommended it all my friends  this and i will  be seeing this place 1 thousand more times

reviews.title: Cars Favoured to Win
text: My boyfriend and I were excited to race at K1 as we hadn’t been. Unfortunately during our (shorter than promised) 12-Lap race, we noticed that certain “regulars” (we noticed them chatting with K1 staff before and after the race), would signal to the staff DURING the race, and their cars would suddenly become faster. Even if you had your foot on the gas at 100%, it was obvious that the output of our cars was significantly different than the ones passing us without hesitation. We’re not competitive people, but for almost $200.00 for 2, 12-lap races, we were expecting it to at least be fair.

reviews.title: Never Again
text: Worst experience.  I spent over to hours in the facility for the 5 kids I brought to spend 10 minutes doing 2 x 12 laps.  There was a close to hour wait between the first 12 lap course and the second 12 lap course.  No need for that.  Staff was horrible.  No one acknowledged me when I came in.  I had to interrupt someone to ask what the process was.  Even after registering the 5 kids no one explained anything to me.   This was my first time here.   Booked a time to be there for what I thought was the start time however that is the time for when you can register and then have to wait 40 minutes for the first 12 lap course.  Staff also told me when I was registering that I should just write that I was a walk in.  So what's the point of registering on line.  What is the point of the 9 dollar registration fee.  It cost me $59 per kid for 10 mins of activity.  The second 12 lap course was also cut short so definitely wasn't worth the money.  You can't  pay me enough money to come back to this place!  I wouldn't even come back if it was free!

reviews.title: Terrible experience... NEVER AGAIN
text: First of all -need to be honest, not at all value for the price, advertise as 12 laps,, finish after 5-6. You don't get what you pay for. over valued, small tracks- 3-4 min drivetime and charge $30. uses membership enrolment as necessity as another way of making money.. this place is not seeing many people ( Mississauga) and I am sure... people go  more for first time experience and lot of them don't go back as I will never and will advise all my friends and family also.
I feel cheated by today experience, yes it is fast.. yes it is not noisy and gas free.. but see the small and how fast they they your off the track,, this is sham and waste of money

reviews.title: Loved K1 lots of fun for a date !
text: loved this place, after going to k1 I started to love go-carting ! Highly recommended. I myself was not interested in go carting but it’s a cool place to go on a date and they also have great bar with amazing vibes !

reviews.title: Great Experience!!
text: We were a big group, and they managed to provide great service! Had lots of fun and was very safe!!!

reviews.title: Exillerating; top-notch facility
text: Brought my son here this summer. He races in a go-kart league in the US and travels in the summer to visit other racing places. He was excited to come and this K1 did not let him down. Staff was friendly. Karts were much different to others as they have a touch screen on steering wheel and a boost button. It was a blast

reviews.title: Awesome Experience for Corporate Event
text: Thanks for K1 Speed at North York, Toronto for arranging corporate event for my company for 24 members
Booking Experience:

I have booked the event by phone and E-mail communication. It was done smoothly as we needed        both go-kart race with food. They have sent us the racing options and Food Menu and after lot of communication we went with 2 races and pizza-wing buffet. They have sent us agreement and we signed and locked a date
Racing Experience:

To participate in the race, we need to sign a waiver from K1 speed. We can do it online from the link which they sent to us by E-mail or at K1 speed location. The staff is very professional and explain everything clearly. We changed our race from 2 races to 3 races and they accommodated graciously.
PIT CREW: Pit crew was nice, they explained all the safety requirements etc.
We took the GRAND PRIX which includes 3 races
1st race: This is a 12 Lap practice race where you get used to race car and track
2nd race: This is a 14 Lap qualifying race from which you lap race time, place you finish position you lap      final race
3rd race: This is a 16 Lap Final race.
Food Experience:
We booked the pizza and wing buffet which was decent. The only drawback was Pop (Coke or Sprite) was not included which we had to buy separately.
Overall a great, awesome and wonderful corporate event we had at K1 speed. Our company members had a wonderful experience and they were very happy with event.
Thank you K1 speed for providing such a great event.

reviews.title: Premium Kart Racing Experince in the GTA
text: Phenomenal upgrade from the previous GPK location, now dominating as the poshest GTA kart faclilty!!

reviews.title: Birthday fun!
text: Service was amazing, the track is a little smaller than I was expecting but the price/amount of time of track is competitive with other companies in the area. Overall would go again.

reviews.title: A must if you want to have fun!!!
text: What a fantastic time. Friendly staff. Clean facility.
Everything I expected and more.
If you want to have fun gocarting, this is definitely the place!!!
A bit difficult to find however. Located in an industrial area, a Hanger!!!

reviews.title: Best activity ever!
text: K1 is a brand new, super clean, well lit, super kid friendly race car zone at Downsview Park. With a week of

reviews.title: PAT Summer Event
text: It was amazing!  Everyone had a fantastic time. Staff were super helpful starting from the reservation, check in, restaurant and the go-karting team who assisted and provided us with instructions. It was seamless from the get-go. We will definitely return again.

reviews.title: K1 speed
text: Great track, awesome karts, and fantastic staff. My son and I will be back. Great family experience!

reviews.title: Awesome team building activity
text: Great value compared to other similar facilities. Good for couples or group events. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Lots of Fun Great Staff!
text: Staff make sure you do have a great time when you visit! I have been back 3 times in 1 month. Strongly reccomend and the food is amazing as well.

reviews.title: Great venue
text: This is probably the best indoor go Kart track I have been to. Really nice, will be back for sure. A+++

reviews.title: Poor scheduling and information
text: Apparently, if you show up to race with kids 13 and under, you may have to wait 4 plus hours for a spot to open, as they were full of events and parties. They said, "you should have called ahead". Sure I could have, but how about you actually use modern technology like a booking system on your website like most places do, and block off times from the public, to display on your website, so walk-ins can check first. What a waste of a drive.

reviews.title: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER
text: We were 4 people, our race was constantly getting stopped, and it was due to someone doing some stupid thing with their car. On top of that, our race(it shouldn't be called a race btw) only lasted for 10 mins with a 55 minute of wait. When we spoke about the issue with the manager on duty he said our race only stopped at lap 6 but that wasn't the case. I would rather go to Formula Karts in Brampton and race on a smaller track but with better management.
The manager gave us only a 10% discount without even listening to our concern. AND WHY THE HELL IS THEIR MEMBERSHIP MANDATORY FOR 9 FRICKING DOLLARS?

reviews.title: Its a parking  game not a race.
text: Worst experience , they kept stopping  in between ("saftey reasons")al most all laps. beacuse  of some girl was not able  to drive ,but it ruined  12 laps for us. Plus their membership  card thing doesn't make sense its mandatory.

reviews.title: Racing was awesome and highly addictive.
text: This place is pretty awesome  good little arcade area, food and drinks and the track and cars are sweet.
You really get those things going fast and it's a workout steering them when hugging the corners. After one race u get a feel for the track and it's fun to watch tour improvement.

The only annoying thing is when u r feeling your groove and then without explanation they shut everyone's cars down. Also, if there are experienced drivers on the track with the ppl ur with, u r expected to slow down, get out of their way and ruin your time so they can get a better track time. In theory it kind makes sense, but when ur new and zipping along, u dont have mirrors so u dont know if the car behind wants to pass on the left or the right and because you're new, it's hard to react that quickly when ur barely holding on without crashing yourself.

I think if u went with a group of ten  or more friends it would be perfect, outside drivers, some who take it very seriously, whereas u r there just for fun... can be a bit annoying because it seems like the operators slow certain ppls cars down so the experienced and regular customers can get by and get a better speed.
Overall, amazing fun and adrenaline pumped experience. Would definitely go again and wish there was one closer to where I live. Awesome awesome awesome!!

reviews.title: Karting in Toronto
text: Very good experience
Lovely and safety place... it has a different group for different ages. Good price.  Thank you. l

reviews.title: Stay away
text: Not a good experience. 12 laps per race promised and got only 10. 7 minutes instead of 10 minutes and cars slowed in favour of some drivers to win. When we complained they admitted it and offered to give us a free race. That’s not what we want. Kids are racing to compete and it’s not fair when they slow their car down to favour a particular driver. Just a terrible experience.

reviews.title: Best karting in Toronto yet!
text: I went today for the first time; if there’s one take away from it is definitely the first of many! I don’t even know where to begin! We got there right at opening, we were immediately greeted with wonderful staff. They set us up and we were on our way within minutes. Before we started I took a quick walk around the facility which was very tidy, well set up and impressively decorated with race car body panels. Then came the karting. The karts were quick, responsive and clearly well maintained.  After two laps the staff decided we were capable of handling the karts at speed and turned the power up to what I would imagine was near the top of their capabilities. What I found probably the most impressive was the live timing printouts they provided at no cost! I’m sure I could go on for a full paragraph more, but to keep it short, it was the best karting experience I’ve had so far and would HIGHLY recommend K1 Toronto to any karting enthusiast or even those looking for a good time!

reviews.title: 2+  hour wait time!!
text: Good things first - this place is new, clean and since go karts are electric, there is no smell from the go karts. Each race consists of 10 go karts on the track and there is a large viewing area. Arcade was okay to occupy our group as we waited.

My recommendation to all "walk in" customers IS TO PHONE AHEAD TO SEE HOW BUSY THEY ARE and find out if there are any "events" taking place that day. An event is a scheduled group where all 10 racers are part of the same group . Our group of 5 got there on Sat at 9:00 p.m. and were told it would be a 1 hour wait due to many booked "events". It ended up being almost  a  2.5  hour wait until our race. Wish they would have been HONEST with the wait time when we signed in.

As well, we had 2 experienced go-kart drivers that were a part of our race that were bumping members of our group (some of which were in-experienced drivers). Unfortunately, that made their first experience go-karting an unpleasant one.
If you decide to go here, I would get 10 people together and schedule an event so as not to have the problems we had.

reviews.title: Amazing go kart experience !
text: Love the go karting there! Prices are above average but worth it. Restaurant is great and arcade is great. Perfect and clean condition. Brand new. Last time I went I got the first race on my own which was amazing. Would definitely come. Am having a big party there coming up soon

reviews.title: Great Place!
text: My overall experience was excellent, good price and the facilities are great. However, sometimes the waiting time is too long for your second race even if you pay for two races in advanced. Normally, it would be one right after the other one, otherwise there is no point of paying for them in advanced.
